CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 22, 1955, pg. 5 reads: "Phar's Former Home - R.C. Phar formerly lived in the trailer shown in the picture. Cordice said that while Phar lived there he told him (Cordice) that neighborhood whites were organizing and planning to use kids to show resentment to Negroes in the neighborhood.  When the Phars lived in the trailer it protruded on the property later bought by Graham L. Anderson.  Upon purchase of the land, Anderson made Phar move the trailer and the outhouse which was located near the fuel drums in the right corner of the picture."
TitMainTitle: Men standing in front of mobile home, single level cinder block house, and outhouse formerly owned by R.C. Phar, Foster Road, North Versailles
